title: Recall Animations for VU'd Champions
body: This is more of a question than rather a concept. All I want to know is why Riot is leaving champions that are getting new animations, such as Maokai, MF, Fiora, without new default recall animations. I mean if they fixed up a couple animations on the champion, why not give it a recall animation? It is understandable to not give recalls to champions who just received TU's. But seeing these new, fresh animations, and models, just standing there when they recall is sorta sad.

replies.body: Every champ should have a unique recall animation. I dont really care if its something stupid like sitting down, it makes it feel much better than looking afk.

For partial visual updates like Fiora's we prioritize animation updates that support ability changes, rather than going for full animation overhauls. The reasoning there is that we believe that generally we can most improve the game by updating the key parts of a larger number of champions, rather than doing everything on a smaller number of champions. Definitely agree there's value in adding recall animations, they're really cool when done well. Need to compare that value to the other work that could be done instead though.

> His/Her point still stands. You have separate teams for each little section, can't be all that much to fit a recall animation into the scale somewhere.

The team that would be creating recall animations for existing champions is the Champion Update team. They're the same folks that do full character relaunches (like Sion) and gameplay driven updates (like Viktor). As a result in this case it is a trade off between animations like recalls and other work on existing champions.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=Ewy6mNU8,comment-id=000500000000,timestamp=2015-07-27T09:03:18.527+0000)

I see what you are saying, but you might as well go all out and put out a masterpiece over just getting something done with the minimum requirements to move on, see what I am trying to get at? 
Quality over quantity, little things do matter.

Trade off there's one of champion quality versus overall game quality. Making one champion the absolute best means less capability to do work on other characters instead. Redoing recall, idle and emote animations on a partial visual update for example will mean being unable to do spell animations for another character, thereby getting a gameplay update out we otherwise wouldn't be able to do. Our feeling is that doing the key work on more champions, rather than polishing a few a lot and leaving others untouched for even longer, is the best way to go, though I can understand the argument for the opposite.
This certainly make sense when we look at it from LOL as an entire product rather than just look at it from champ to cahmp.

Have you decided if you'll get back to those partial reworks in the far future? I.e. does the decision not to give Fiora a recall or new VO mean she will _never_ get that, even when all the "big offenders" and most of the reworks are done? Fiora may not be the best example, but Alistar comes to mind.

We don't have any conceptual problems with going back and doing additional work on characters that get partial updates. As with any piece of work it'll just depend on what the value from doing other competing work looks like. 

Right now for example sinking time into some upcoming smaller gameplay updates plus one much larger relaunch (Poppy) is what we feel's most valuable. At some point though going back and doing some of the bits we missed the first time round (Ryze VO, Fiora recall etc) could well be higher value than updates for characters who haven't received any updates but only have minor issues.

Fiora's "partial VU" was the perfect opportunity to somewhat rectify the Headmistress Fiora recall animation issue from a few years ago.

Yes, I still remember that.

Note: use of the word "WE" in assumptions
What I and I'm sure others fear is the endless cycle problem. Wherein now that there is a team dedicated to Champion Updates we will see them go through most of the champions before they ever come back to one to do touch ups. Where we believe that it would have been better to have just planned and done it from the beginning.  For example the Cass dispute where she was no longer being worked on despite telling us she is still being iterated on. We fear the same will come to pass for small things like this.

Of course, there's subjectivity involved in making the calls. Although, It seems obvious that sacrificing recall-animations for, say, 2-3 reworks would be worthwhile if moving those animation-resources would mean they'd release three VU's instead of two within the same timeframe. 

If they actually do get back to old VU's, I think having two-thirds of the work done this year and the rest done in two years is better than having to wait 3-4 years for the same total work. That's also subjective, though.

I'm glad to hear that! I suspected that'd be the case, but it's always been a bit ambiguous. I hope you keep the VU team going for stuff like this rather than scaling it down once the big projects are done.

why not take a little extra time to polish every champion like say a month or two for each update and then release them periodically once a month...maybe even have more than one champion at a time assuming not all of the champions need that much work... or even devote 2 weeks to each champion or something.... devote all your resources to one at a time... then go to the next... juggling too much at once can be an issue and difficult to do as you have seen from some past mishaps as a company or the release of champs that were way too powerful when released because you tried to rush it.

I feel like just a small animation would be fine.

Kind of like Darius just holding up his Axe, I feel like just having Fiora hold her sword like her old passive: http://img3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20121107025842/leagueoflegends/images/c/c8/Duelist.jpg

Would just be find for a recall.

Let me guess, Cassiopeia falls under the same category? 

First your collegues feel like gutting her gameplay and now you're abandoning her without any plans for new animations, not even a recall? How come Vel'Koz and his flying appendages have far superior fluidity in their movements whereas Cassio's tail still remains extremely outdated? Cassiopeia in general feels unfinished and rushed. All you did was replace some of her textures (not even a new model) while slapping probably the most hated rework in the history of this game on her just to call it a day.

Nine months later and you still haven't planned anything new for her, not even a skin (her last one came out in 2013). Well, not good enough for that apparently, but bad enough for a lazy set of chromas. For how much longer are you going to neglect her? Do you expect me to simply forget? Cassiopeia players have needs, too.
I can understand, But maybe give champions like idk for example *cough Fiora, a really big fancy skin that has its own animations and effects a recall animation :O!

Well, then. We'll have to wait another 3-4 years so you will feel like finishing the job you started.

Oh, but by then the part you did now will be obsolete and will have to be redone.

See you in Season 2256.

Time = Money 

On a serious note, only high end skins get that treatment. The temptation works too.

I think they only rework the model, texture and VFX in VUs but don't rework the rig (aka the skeleton which you animate).
Sometimes they update animations but never add recall animation, which honestly is somewhat depressing because champions who get VUs will never be updated again, so they just look old near every champion from {{champion:122}} and onwards animation-wise.

You are right about everything (I think) except for one thing: {{champion:41}}  has had two VU's.  He had his first a few years ago when they removed his original E: the one that killed minions to get the buff (aka "Chest Hair GP")

I really wish they would do recall animations for their VUs though.

[Well that was in 2011](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=1522028&page=1#post17646158) when the game was growing way faster than it is now content-wise and things were rushed out much faster with champions every 2 weeks.

"Champions who get VU's will never be updated again"

Riot has never said this. Gangplank disproves this.

It is a matter of cost versus benefit.

While recall animations and complex dances and emotes are really fun to watch in game, they consume time as they not only need to be animated, but ideated, conceptialized, sketched and studied beforehand, then surveyed by  QA and other pertintent departments afterwards.

It is not easy to simply add them, and in the case of champion VU's, each time invested in an update pushes back the release date of not only the one that is worked on, but every other that will come after it. In the case of skins, there is just a delay in when the skin will come, but by adding a recall animation to the Miss Fortune update, you are relegating Ryze/Teemo/Fiora/whoever update by the time that is required to process the feature.

Add to the fact that, as has been mentioned before by Riot Games, their animation department is a natural bottleneck for them, as they use tradional animation for their models rather than motion-capture animation, so it is difficult for them to find enough experienced animation artists to support the workload (or at least was this way when they posted it).
So Theres VU- Visual Updates SVU- Small Visual Update TU- Texture Update NTVU- No Taric Visual Update :<

I understand them not giving {{champion:57}} {{champion:12}} and {{champion:21}}  recall animations, they honestly made light changes on the models to update them, but I still think they should add recall animations for the sake of keeping them up to date. also, they should give new jokes/ taunts (along with interactions with other champs) for the more boring ones... >_> {{champion:26}} {{champion:62}}
Been thinking about the same thing for soo long
